item.title: Mississippi Prison Killings Have Not Stopped. 5 Things to Know.
item.description: Over 10 years, the reasons for the killings are often the same: Severe understaffing, lax oversight and gang violence.

item.title: New York Prisons Are Getting More Cameras. Will It Make Them Safer?
item.description: The state plans to install cameras in “blind spots,” following two high-profile prisoner deaths and extensive reporting about abuse by guards.

item.title: How Missouri Denied Condemned Men Spiritual Advisers at Their Deaths
item.description: “We’re talking about constitutional rights in someone’s dying moments,” one advocate said.

item.title: Before ICE Shooting, Immigration Agents Repeatedly Used Deadly Force
item.description: The killing of a Minneapolis woman is latest by ICE and Border Patrol officers in recent months. Others have been wounded or threatened with guns.

item.title: Who’s in Ohio’s Psychiatric Hospitals, How Did They Get There and When Do They Get Out?
item.description: Criminal defendants are overwhelming an understaffed state mental health system that, a few years ago, served thousands more patients.
